business.headline: Sensex, Nifty open lower as Trump tariffs keep Dalal Street on edgeSensex falls over 150 points, Nifty trades around 24,550, Airtel down 3%

Trump rules out trade talks with India amid tariffs: Will Dalal Street face the heat?With Donald Trump ruling out any negotiations "until it is resolved," Dalal Street could witness a turbulent period as geopolitical tensions spill into the market.

Trump's tariff: What Indian refiners stand to lose if Russian oil stops flowingFor over two years, Indian refiners have been taking advantage of discounted Russian crude. But with the US tightening its stance, that door may soon begin to close.

US targets one-kilo gold bars with new import tariffs: ReportFollowing the US government's announcement last week of a broad 39% tariff on imports from Switzerland, this exacerbates already existing trade tensions between Bern and Washington.

Trump tariffs: US consumers face price hikes across major brandsIn the household goods sector, Procter & Gamble said it plans to raise prices on 25% of its North American products due to the impact of tariffs and product innovation.

Despite war and warnings, US traded more with Russia than ally UkraineUS President Donald Trump alleges that India has been financing the Russian invasion of Ukraine by importing oil. However, data by the US Census Bureau presents a different picture.

How India plans to tackle Trump's tariff threatIndia has already held five rounds of trade talks with the US, but no deal has been reached. The talks failed mainly because of disagreements over opening India's farm and dairy sectors, and the issue of buying oil from Russia.

Indian refiners hit pause on Russian oil imports after 50% tariff blow: ReportRefiners like Indian Oil Corporation, Bharat Petroleum Corporation and Hindustan Petroleum Corporation have decided not to buy Russian oil on the spot market in the upcoming buying cycle.
Sensex, Nifty end in green as D-Street investors ignore Trump's 50% tariffsThe S&P BSE Sensex added 79.27 points to end at 80,623.26, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 21.95 points to close at 24,596.15.

Why STP and SWP matter more than SIP, explains stock market expertSIPs help you enter the world of investing. But STPs and SWPs help you navigate it wisely, especially when you have a big lump sum to invest or need steady income without eating into your entire savings.

From ally to 'dead economy': Timeline of Trump's tariff turn on IndiaTrump signed an executive order imposing an additional 25% tariff on Indian goods, bringing the total to 50% on August 6, putting India among the most heavily tariffed nations.

Nayara Energy seeks ships from India to ferry refined fuels: ReportSanctions-hit Nayara is struggling to get vessels for the supply of refined fuels for its retail stations in India. The private refiner has already cut crude runs at its refinery.

Adani to build India's biggest privately funded coal power plant in a decadeThe first of three units at the plant will be commissioned within four years, with the last expected to come online in five years' time, Adani Power said.

TCS hikes salaries for 80% staff amid layoffs: ReportIn a message sent to employees, the company confirmed that the salary increase will apply to around 80% of the workforce and will take effect from September 1, 2025.

How Trump's 100% chip tariff plan has shaken the global semiconductor industrySpeaking from the Oval Office, Trump said the move is aimed at boosting local manufacturing and reducing reliance on foreign-made chips. He added that companies like Apple, which recently committed an extra $100 billion investment in the US, would not be charged the new tariffs.

Trump hits India with 50% tariffs: What's at stake and what next?A sweeping 50% tariff could significantly impact India's export economy, threatening jobs and trade ties. As Donald Trump ramps up pressure, all eyes are now on New Delhi's next move.

From seafood to auto: How will Trump's 50% tariff impact different sectorsThe tariff hike, set to take effect from August 27, follows a warning issued by Trump earlier over India's continued oil imports from Russia.

Skipped your ITR for years? Here's how it can impact you legally and financiallyIt might feel harmless to skip filing your Income Tax Return once or twice, but if you've been ignoring it for years, you could be heading for serious trouble. From steep penalties to even jail time, here's what you need to know before it's too late.

JSW Cement IPO opens for subscription. Should you apply or skip?Brokerages are mostly positive about JSW Cement IPO, though some advise caution due to the stretched valuation and inconsistent profitability.

Sensex tanks 500 points on 50% Trump's tariff blow: Should Investors worry?The Sensex slipped over 250 points at the open before paring some losses. The Nifty50 was also trading lower, reflecting broad-based caution and expectations of a volatile trading session.

Sensex, Nifty fall as Trump announces additional tariffs; experts advise cautionWhile Sensex opened 250 points lower, it was trading just 131.05 points lower at 80,412.94 at 9:22 am, indicating that the session could see wild swings and high volatility. Nifty50 was also down 67.25 points to 24,506.95.

How India can turn Trump's tariffs into a strategic advantageThe new tariff of an additional 25%, announced on Wednesday, will come into effect 21 days from August 7. This sharp increase in duties comes at a time when trade talks between the two countries have reached a dead end.

PM's Economic Advisory Council members on Trump's tariff war, India's growth strategyPrime Minister Narendra Modi's Economic Advisory Council members, Dr Sajjid Chinoy and Neelkanth Mishra, share their perspectives on the additional 25 per cent tariffs imposed by Donald Trump on Indian imports to the US over buying Russian oil and India's growth strategy.

ICICI, HDFC, Union Bank and others offer attractive 3-year FD rates. Should you invest now?FDs remain one of the safest investment options for those looking for steady returns without risk. However, with repo rates possibly heading downward in the future, locking in higher FD rates now could be a smart financial move.

Should you subscribe to this IPO with over 50% listing gains? Check detailsThe public issue is worth Rs 130 crore, made up of a fresh issue of 1.39 crore shares amounting to Rs 97.52 crore, and an offer for sale of 46 lakh shares worth Rs 32.48 crore.
US tariffs won't shake India's economy, says reportThe PHD Chamber of Commerce and Industry (PHDCCI) white paper finds only 1.87% impact on exports and 0.19% on GDP from the new US trade barrier.

India's $64 billion US trade at risk as tensions with Washington escalateIndia faces its most serious diplomatic crisis with the US in years after Trump imposed the highest tariffs among Asian peers on goods imported from India, even before any penalty.
Sensex, Nifty end lower as US trade tension; RBI rate pause hit sentimentThe S&P BSE Sensex ended 166.26 points lower to end at 80,543.99, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 75.35 points to end at 24,574.20.

Edelweiss' Radhika Gupta on why large cap is the new debtTraditionally, people invested in debt, like fixed deposits or bonds, when they wanted safety. They turned to equity, like stocks, when they were willing to take more risk for higher returns. But that line is getting blurry.

Is social media ruining investing for Gen Z?Social media is reshaping how young Indians invest. With financial influencer or 'finfluencer' on the rise, traditional financial literacy is being replaced by reels and short YouTube videos.

Trump says don't know anything about US-Russia imports. But here's what we knowUS President Donald Trump recently said he was unaware that the United States still imports goods like uranium and fertilisers from Russia. His comments came after India defended its oil trade with Moscow.

Can AI manage your investment portfolio?AI is rapidly changing how we invest. From portfolio tracking to fund recommendations, it's already doing the heavy lifting. But can it take full charge of your investments, and, should it?

From easier claim rules to Jan-dhan scheme: RBI's 3 key reforms for common manOne of the major announcements is aimed at easing the process for families to claim money or valuables from bank accounts, lockers, or safe custody after the account holder passes away.

Will US tariffs hit India's economy? What RBI Governor saidThe three-day meeting concluded with Governor Sanjay Malhotra outlining the central bank's views on inflation, growth, and importantly, the growing global trade tensions triggered by tariff announcements, especially by the United States.

Forgot to e-verify your ITR? Here's what to do to avoid penaltiesEven though the new ITR deadline is now September 15, 2025 for several taxpayers, the 30-day e-verification window begins the moment you file your return and not from the due date.

Should you hold or sell NSDL shares after stock market listing? Details hereWhile NSDL may not offer sharp near-term upside post listing, many analysts see it as a core holding in India's market infrastructure play, particularly as digital finance expands and retail participation deepens.

NSDL shares debut with 10% premium over IPO issue priceNSDL's Rs 4,012 crore initial public offering was entirely an offer for sale (OFS) involving 5.01 crore equity shares. The issue saw robust demand from all investor segments, with an overall subscription of 41.02 times.

RBI keeps key lending rate steady at 5.5% amid global trade uncertaintyThe RBI MPC sighted the global tensions and trade uncertainty in keeping key lending rates unchanged. The MPC also decided to continue with a neutral stance.

Sensex, Nifty off to shaky start amid Trump tariff threat, RBI rate decisionThe S&P BSE Sensex was down 65.70 points to 80.644.34 at 9:40 am, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 28.40 points to trade at 24,620.

entertainment.headline: Robert Pattinson's Batman Part II to begin filming in 2026, release pushed to 2027Warner Bros Discovery confirmed 'The Batman Part II' to film in 2026, aiming for a 2027 release. Directed by Matt Reeves, it stars Robert Pattinson.

Salakaar review: Naveen Kasturia's nuclear spy drama is intriguing but inconsistentRelease Date:Fri Aug 08, 2025Salakaar series review: 'Salakaar' is a spy thriller inspired by real India-Pakistan nuclear espionage events. The series mixes political intrigue with flawed spy characters, offering a slow-burn drama with some logical lapses.

Himesh Reshammiya becomes first Indian artist on Bloomberg's Pop Power ListHimesh Reshammiya has made history as the first Indian artist to feature on Bloomberg's Pop Power List. He secured the 22nd spot with global pop icons, Post Malone, Bruno Mars and Beyonce leading the list.

Hansal Mehta's Gandhi, first ever series, to premiere at Toronto Film festivalHansal Mehta's series 'Gandhi' became the first Indian series to debut at the Toronto International Film Festival. AR Rahman, who has composed the music, announced the news on his official social media pages.

Lokesh Kanagaraj's full-circle moment: Once a bus conductor's son, now directing oneDirector Lokesh Kanagaraj's upcoming film, 'Coolie', features Rajinikanth in the lead role. Before the release of the film, let us take a look at the inspiring story of the filmmaker, who, without formal training, managed to direct some of the greats of Tamil cinema.

MS Dhoni and Coolie composer Anirudh play Padel at Chennai court. Viral videoMahendra Singh Dhoni and composer Anirudh Ravichander were seen playing Padel at the cricketer's newly launched court in Chennai. A video of them is going viral on social media.

Skydance seals $8 billion merger with Paramount after lawsuit dealSkydance finalised an $8 billion merger with Paramount, gaining control of major media assets. The deal follows political controversy and signals a shift in strategy under new CEO David Ellison.

Saiyaara casting director Shanoo Sharma reveals why Ahaan Panday refused to meet her'Saiyaara' casting director Shanoo Sharma shared an interesting anecdote about actor Ahaan Panday. Sharma recalled when Panday once refused to meet her due to his own fears.

Kamal Haasan meets PM Modi, seeks support for recognition of Keeladi's antiquityActor and Rajya Sabha MP, Kamal Haasan met Prime Minister Narendra Modi to seek expedited recognition of Keeladi's antiquity. He highlighted the need to promote Tamil civilisation and language on a global stage.

Centre issues notice to Marathi film 'Khalid Ka Shivaji' makers amid ban callsThe I&B ministry has issued a notice to the makers of the Marathi film Khalid Ka Shivaji following protests over the secular portrayal of Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj in the movie.

The Thursday Murder Club trailer: Veteran sleuths lead the probe on mysterious deathNetflix released the trailer for The Thursday Murder Club, a mystery film based on Richard Osman's bestselling novel. The story follows four retirees who solve cold cases, leading to a thrilling murder investigation on their doorstep.

Jolly LLB 3: Saurabh Shukla teases courtroom chaos with two JollysGet ready for chaos as 'Jolly LLB 3' returns with Akshay Kumar and Arshad Warsi, alongside Saurabh Shukla as Judge Tripathi. The teaser will release on August 12,

When Farida Jalal warned Shruti Seth not to correct big stars on Fanaa setActor Shruti Seth recalls Farida Jalal's playful warning during 'Fanaa' shoot and shares her experience working with Aamir Khan and Kajol.

Aamir Khan not involved in Coolie Hindi release, confirms production teamActor Aamir Khan's appearance in superstar Rajinikanth's much-awaited film 'Coolie' is only a goodwill gesture. Contrary to recent reports, a statement by the actor's team on Thursday stated that he is not involved in the film's distribution and has not made any calls.

I'm done chasing stars: Sunil Darshan opens up on choosing newcomersDirector Sunil Darshan, in an exclusive interaction with India Today, spoke about casting newcomers in his upcoming film 'Andaaz 2'. He even reflected on his past collaborations with prominent stars.

Elnaaz Norouzi declines Rs 6 crore offer to participate in Bigg Boss 19 : ExclusiveActor Elnaaz Norouzi turned down a Rs 6 crore offer to participate in Salman Khan-hosted 'Bigg Boss 19.' A source close to the development cited the actor's professional commitments behind the decision.

Top 5 movies and shows to watch on Prime Video this weekendTop picks to stream on Prime Video this weekend, from thrillers to heartfelt dramas, including Eddie Murphy's 'The Pickup' and Telugu hit 'Arabia Kadali'.

Coolie vs War 2 advance booking: Rajinikanth's film leads with 60% buzz | Exclusive'Coolie' and 'War 2' are set to clash at the box office this Independence Day weekend. The battle pits strong pan-India star casts against regional dominance, promising a thrilling cinematic showdown.

Sholay@50: The Making of Gabbar, Bollywood's Greatest VillainWhat made Gabbar Singh the greatest villain in Bollywood history? It wasn't just Amjad's performance, though his raw intensity was undeniable. It was the magic of Salim-Javed's writing, Sippy's vision, and Amjad's ability to transcend the archetype of the Bollywood villain.

general news.headline: Trump drops another bomb, halts trade talks with India amid tariff rowThe US president ruled out trade negotiations with India after imposing a 50% tariff on Indian imports over its Russian oil purchases. India criticised the move as unfair and hit back at the double standards.

Give the bully an inch…: China envoy to India slams Trump over tariffsThe remarks by the Chinese ambassador to India are being seen as expressing solidarity with countries like India and Brazil, who have been at the receiving end of Trump's aggressive tariffs.

India-Russia bear hug is another Trump self-goalThough India and Russia had strong ties, New Delhi was trying to balance that as relations with the US were on the upswing. However, Donald Trump's tariff bazooka might see India's Russia hug get tighter. Russian President Putin is set to visit New Delhi later this year. Trump has, ironically, driven India towards Russia like the US did with its arms embargo in the mid-60s.

1,00,250 vote chori: Rahul Gandhi's presentation at INDIA bloc dinner meetAt the core of the discussions was a detailed presentation by Rahul Gandhi titled "Democracy Destroyed," in which he briefed the INDIA bloc leadership on alleged booth-level electoral frauds.

Who after Bumrah and Siraj? Is India's fast-bowling assembly line drying up?With Jasprit Bumrah and Mohammed Siraj now past 30, the big question looms: who takes over as the leader of India's pace attack? Among the frontrunners are Arshdeep Singh, Akash Deep, Prasidh Krishna, and Harshit Rana - all promising, but yet to fully cement their place.

Actor Huma Qureshi's cousin brother murdered in Delhi, two accused arrestedA dispute between Asif and a few men erupted over the parking of a two-wheeler in front of the main gate of his house, following which the accused attacked him with sharp weapons.

Trumpian Tariffs on India: Who pays? Who gains?Tariff liberalisation has been a factor leading to consumption growth in India, which has again been the prime driver of its economic growth. It is therefore important that India should shed off its protectionist status and rather actively accelerate efforts to diversify trade partners beyond the US and strengthen ties with other global players.

Serious questions: Shashi Tharoor backs Rahul Gandhi's vote 'chori' claimsCongress MP Shashi Tharoor backed Rahul Gandhi's claims of "huge criminal fraud" in the 2024 Lok Sabha polls, urging the Election Commission to respond, after Gandhi alleged BJP-EC collusion and vote theft.

Sholay@50: The Making of Gabbar, Bollywood's Greatest VillainWhat made Gabbar Singh the greatest villain in Bollywood history? It wasn't just Amjad's performance, though his raw intensity was undeniable. It was the magic of Salim-Javed's writing, Sippy's vision, and Amjad's ability to transcend the archetype of the Bollywood villain.

Why additional Trump tariffs will be a big pain point for IndiaThe extra 25 per cent 'ad valorem' duty on Indian imports—seen as a new negotiating tactic by the Trump administration—will have a sizeable impact on India's growth in the short term

China's opposition clear: India finds an unlikely ally as Beijing slams US tariffsThe strong response came after US President Donald Trump signed an executive order placing an additional 25 per cent tariff on Indian goods, taking the total import duty to 50 per cent.

Where 'Ram Teri Ganga Maili' lived, silence now falls over a shattered valleyThe same landscapes that drew director Raj Kapoor to create a cinematic ode to purity, love, and nature now lie devastated in the aftermath of a deadly flash flood.

JD Vance went on kayak trip on birthday. Military secretly raised river levelThe Secret Service raised water levels in Ohio's Little Miami river for Vice President JD Vance's birthday kayaking trip, prompting criticism over taxpayer spending and comparisons to past political privileges.

Rahul Gandhi's 3-state fake voter charge: The curious case of Aditya SrivastavaRahul Gandhi had presented the EPIC number of a person named Aditya Srivastava from Lucknow claiming that in addition to Karnataka, he was also a voter in UP. He even displayed his face, photograph, and EPIC number during the presentation. Not only that, he also claimed that this person appeared on the voter list of Maharashtra.

Salakaar review: Naveen Kasturia's nuclear spy drama is intriguing but inconsistentRelease Date:Fri Aug 08, 2025Salakaar series review: 'Salakaar' is a spy thriller inspired by real India-Pakistan nuclear espionage events. The series mixes political intrigue with flawed spy characters, offering a slow-burn drama with some logical lapses.

Netanyahu's plan to take control of Gaza City gets security cabinet nodThe move has raised fears of more casualties in the war with Hamas that has already left thousands of Palestinians dead, and turned much of Gaza into rubble.

Dining solo might be the best thing you do this weekNext time you feel awkward about going on a solo date, know that eating alone can be really refreshing. It helps you slow down, enjoy your food, and connect with yourself.

Ajit Doval meets Putin in Moscow day after Trump doubles tariff on IndiaIndia and Russia stressed their commitment to a "strategic partnership" during bilateral security talks in Moscow, held a day after US President Donald Trump announced higher tariffs on Indian imports in response to India's continued purchases of Russian oil.

Chest pain, strokes, severe bleeding: These emergencies need an ambulance, not a driveRecognising true medical emergencies can save lives by ensuring timely treatment. Knowing when to call an ambulance versus driving can prevent irreversible harm.

ChatGPT 5 is here, Sam Altman says it is like talking to expert who knows everythingOpenAI on Thursday night introduced ChatGPT 5, or rather GPT-5, which is its next-generation AI system. The company says that ChatGPT 5 brings PhD-level knowledge in every subject to everyone.

Open office, closed minds? Why babus feel exposed in Kartavya BhavanPrime Minister Narendra Modi inaugurated the Kartavya Bhavan-3, which will house several ministries of the Central government. However, top Central government officers have written to the PMO over the lack of private cabins in the building. They say the open-seating arrangement compromises confidentiality, affects efficiency and is demoralising.

US calls India strategic partner, vows full and frank talks despite trade, oil riftThe US pledges to maintain dialogue despite ongoing disputes over tariffs, trade imbalances, and India's Russian oil imports, although President Trump has ruled out further trade talks until these issues are resolved.

Shots fired at Kapil Sharma's Canada cafe again, Lawrence Bishnoi claims attackKapil Sharma's cafe in Canada once again came under attack, marking second incident in a month. Gangster Goldy Dhillon has claimed responsibility this time.

Pak's Indus delta sees 80% dip in freshwater; 1.2M people displacedThe Indus delta in Pakistan is drowning in seawater due to decades of mismanagement, climate change, and hydropower projects. Freshwater supply has dipped by 80% and 1.2 million people have been displaced as salinity hits farming and fisheries. India's suspension of the Indus Waters Treaty further complicates recovery.

Arabia Kadali review: Krish Jagarlamudi's sincere drama struggles to stay afloatRelease Date:Fri Aug 08, 2025'Arabia Kadali' series review: 'Arabia Kadali' presents a heartfelt and sincere retelling of a real-life crisis, combining a grounded human story with thematic depth. While the intent is solid and the performances authentic, the series suffers from dated presentation, occasional cliches, and uneven emotional engagement.

Robert Pattinson's Batman Part II to begin filming in 2026, release pushed to 2027Warner Bros Discovery confirmed 'The Batman Part II' to film in 2026, aiming for a 2027 release. Directed by Matt Reeves, it stars Robert Pattinson.

Before the release of the film, let us take a look at the inspiring story of the filmmaker, who, without formal training, managed to direct some of the greats of Tamil cinema.

sports.headline: Gambhir assured my son that he will get chances: Abhimanyu Easwaran's fatherAbhimanyu Easwaran's father, Ranganathan Easwaran, has revealed that India head coach Gautam Gambhir has assured his son of getting chances in the playing XI. Abhimanyu couldn't find a place in the playing XI in the five-match Test series against England.

Dinesh Karthik hits back at Bumrah's critics: India's defeats are not his faultFormer India cricketer turned commentator Dinesh Karthik has slammed Jasprit Bumrah's critics, saying that it's not his fault that India lost Test matches in England despite his presence.

Is India's fast-bowling assembly line drying up?With Jasprit Bumrah and Mohammed Siraj now past 30, the big question looms: who takes over as the leader of India's pace attack? Among the frontrunners are Arshdeep Singh, Akash Deep, Prasidh Krishna, and Harshit Rana - all promising, but yet to fully cement their place.

Pakistan Cricket Board suspends Haider Ali amid UK criminal investigation: ReportThe Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) has provisionally suspended cricketer Haider Ali after it emerged that the 24-year-old batter is under criminal investigation by Greater Manchester Police in the United Kingdom.

Chennai Grandmasters 2025: Erigaisi takes dominant win, Keymer downs SarinArjun Erigaisi kicked off his Chennai Grandmasters campaign with a dominant win over Awonder Liang, while Vincent Keymer stunned Nihal Sarin in the opening round of this high-stakes tournament.

Ashes 2025: Glenn McGrath backs Australia to whitewash England 5-0Legendary pacer Glenn McGrath predicts a 5-0 Ashes whitewash for Australia in the 2025–26 series. McGrath's confidence stems from Australia's strong bowling lineup and favourable home conditions, posing a tough challenge for England.

Shikhar Dhawan pens emotional post for son Zoraver during WCL stintIn a heartfelt post, Shikhar Dhawan opened up about his son Zoraver, offering a rare glimpse into a deeply personal side of his life. Sharing a series of previously unseen photographs, the cricketer reflected on fatherhood, separation, and the small moments that continue to linger long after they've passed.

2nd Test: Henry eclipses Taylor's return as New Zealand take control on Day 1Matt Henry continued his outstanding form with another five-wicket haul as New Zealand took firm control of the second Test in Bulawayo, bowling Zimbabwe out for 125 and reaching 174 for 1 in reply by stumps on the opening day.

Duleep Trophy: Jurel to lead Central Zone, Karun left out amid Test returnDhruv Jurel is set to lead Central Zone in the upcoming Duleep Trophy campaign. The spin-bowling unit will have Kuldeep Yadav leading the line alongside Harsh Dubey and Manav Suthar.

WFI suspend 11 athletes for submitting fake birth certificatesThe Wrestling Federation of India have suspended 11 athletes for submitting fake certificates. The decision comes after the MCD cross-checked the certificates forwarded by WFI.

Barcelona strips Ter Stegen of captaincy over medical report disputeBarcelona have temporarily stripped veteran goalkeeper Marc-André ter Stegen of the captaincy following a dispute over his refusal to sign a medical report related to his recent back surgery, further highlighting the club's ongoing financial and squad registration issues.

Back after drug rehabilitation, Taylor top-scores for Zimbabwe vs NZBrendan Taylor made a resilient return to international cricket after a long ban. His unbeaten innings showed signs of his previous resolve as Zimbabwe crashed against New Zealand bowling attack.

From Ousmane Dembele to Lamine Yamal: Ballon d'Or 2025 full list of nomineesThe top 30 nominees have been unveiled for the Ballon d'Or 2025. Some of the obvious names have been included but there are some interesting picks as well which will leave you wondering as to why they are there.

Olympic champion Viktor Axelsen withdraws from World Championships due to injuryTwo-time Olympic champion Viktor Axelsen has withdrawn from the BWF World Championships due to injury. The Danish shuttler underwent back surgery in April.

Manchester United agree deal with RB Leipzig to sign Benjamin Sesko: ReportManchester United have struck an agreement in principle with RB Leipzig to sign 22-year-old striker Benjamin Sesko in a deal worth €76.5 million plus €8.5 million in add-ons, according to The Athletic's David Ornstein.

Blow for Bengaluru stadium: Local T20 tournament moved ahead of Women's World CupThe Maharaja T20 Trophy has been relocated from Bengaluru to Mysuru due to safety concerns at M Chinnaswamy Stadium. This move follows a judicial report declaring the stadium unsafe for large events.

Time to move on from WTC win: Kagiso Rabada shifts focus for Australia tourAUS vs SA: Kagiso Rabada wanted to move on from South Africa's WTC triumph over Australia as he shifts to limited-overs cricket in their next tour to Australia. He hoping to build his performances in lead up to the T20 World Cup next year.

Sanju Samson hands in trade request to Rajasthan Royals: ReportSanju Samson has requested a transfer from Rajasthan Royals ahead of IPL 2026. The move follows a disappointing 2025 season and reported differences with coach Rahul Dravid.

Joe Root will have nightmares about Josh Hazlewood before Ashes: David WarnerWith the Ashes set to take place in Australia later this year, David Warner has once again taken a dig at Joe Root, suggesting the England batter still struggles against Josh Hazlewood — and might already be thinking about it.

With Cooley leaving, BCCI starts hunt for new coaches at Centre of ExcellenceThe BCCI's Centre of Excellence is gearing up for a major overhaul of its coaching staff, with applications invited for key positions in the bowling, batting, and sports science and medicine departments.

Bumrah didn't perform like no 1 bowler in England, should've pushed harder: PathanFormer India all rounder Irfan Pathan has said that Jasprit Bumrah didn't perform like the number one bowler in England and should've pushed himself harder.

What is Continental Tour? World Athletics event being held in India for the first timeIndia will host the World Athletics Continental Tour Bronze event for the first time. Set to be hosted in Bhubaneshwar's Kalinga Stadium, several top Indian athletes will be in focus at the one-day event.

Tottenham's James Maddison sidelined from action after pre-season ACL tearJames Maddison will be out of action for most of the 2024-25 season after picking up an ACL injury during their pre-season game against Newcastle United.

England not in favour of two-tier World Test Championship and their reason is bizarreECB chairman Richard Thompson has raised concerns over the proposed two-tier Test cricket structure. He fears relegation could prevent England from regularly playing top teams like India and Australia, urging for better scheduling instead.

Jannik Sinner eyes Cincinnati title defence after much-needed recoveryWorld number one Jannik Sinner said he made the right decision by taking an extended break after his Wimbledon triumph, and the recharged Italian is now ready to defend his title at the Cincinnati Open.

Shubman Gill to captain star-studded North Zone side in Duleep TrophyIndia Test captain Shubman Gill will lead North Zone in the Duleep Trophy 2025. The team will have the services of Arshdeep Singh and Harshit Rana.

BFI official told me to shut up and lower my head, Lovlina Borgohain saysLovlina Borgohain has reportedly levelled accusations against a BFI official for gender-discriminatory behaviour during a TOPS meeting. The matter is being invesigated by a three-member panel on the Sports Ministry's instructions.

Konstas, McSweeney named in Australia A squad for India tour in SeptemberAustralia A has announced a 14-member men's squad for the upcoming tour of India in September. The selection focuses on developing young talent and spin options ahead of the 2027 Test series in India.

Gill doesn't need Jasprit Bumrah, India can win Tests without him: PanesarMonty Panesar praised Shubman Gill's leadership in first series as India's Test captain. He also applauded Mohammed Siraj and hailed him to be the key for India's bowling attack.

Hoping to hold ISL, AIFF will not interfere in clubs' operations: Kalyan ChaubeyAll India Football Federation (AIFF) president Kalyan Chaubey on Thursday expressed hope that the Indian Super League (ISL) will be held later this year, even if it requires adjustments to the format or schedule.

Joe Root will break Tendulkar's record and score 18000 Test runs: Former spinnerStar England batter Joe Root has been backed by former England spinner Monty Panesar to break Sachin Tendulkar's record for most Test runs and score 18000 runs in Tests.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
